title: About
text:
My name is Surya and I am a high school student interested in math and computer science.
I created this project as a part of Kane’s Summer Data Science Bootcamp.
The github repo for this project can be accessed here

title: US Internet Access
text: Over the past several years access to internet has become much more universal across America; however, some famillies still do not have steady access to the internet. Using data from the 2021 5-year American Community Survey, I seek to determine the impact of household income and age on Americans’ access to internet.

\[
\log\left(\frac{P(\text{accessinet\_binary} = 1)}{1 - P(\text{accessinet\_binary} = 1)}\right)
= 3.04 - 0.0339 \cdot \text{agep} + 0.00000704 \cdot \text{hincp} + 0.000000130 \cdot (\text{agep} \times \text{hincp})
\]

title: Sources
text: Data for this project came from the 2021 5-year ACS- both individual and household level data was used. To clean the data, “NA” values were omitted, and, for simplicty’s sake, “accessinet” values of “No” and “Limited” were combined into one category.
